content:
should we specify a rust-toolchain in the project root? there's somewhat churn happening right now with rust-fmt. i think they changed they changed how it formats code, so the tidy check fails on my machine, but passed in CI, until i thought to upgrade to latest rust stable.

and then i saw another pr recently that tried to format the file with older rustfmt too.

I don't think we gain anything from using a rust toolchain file, these format changes happen rarely and we usually adjust our crates to only built on latest stable anyways(we haven't done this for 1.58 yet) so the project wouldn't built on older versions usually

Yeah, this only happens twice a year or so. This time I reformatted the code in https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/pull/11277, which took less than what we'd spend messing with rust-toolchain.toml.
huh? is it that much work? in my other workspaces i just add a file called rust-toolchain and set it to to whatever the latest stable is...
Which means updating it on every release :stuck_out_tongue:
